author: drakemonroe
title: UniCloak
description: No Standard in the Cardano Transaction Metadata Label Registry to call on a Standard for secure financial data on-chain.

assessments.note: This proposal provides an interesting use case for metadata which is also protected by encryption. What isn't clear is how this idea will advance the use of cardano's metadata, and why this needs to be on chain. For instance, I can store encrypted files and transfer them already without needing to use cardano.

Although a label registry for on-chain financial data is relevant to the Metadata Challenge, the proposal does not effectively detail the specific approach and solution for achieving that. Rather, it states requirements and assumes that third-party capabilities would be available to support the solution of the stated problem.

This proposal does pose to solve an interesting future issue concerning the next phase of financial infrastructure being built in the Cardano Ecosystem.  Details are provided, but a further statement to show the impact of why if not completed would help to drive the impactfulness of the project.
This is not really a plan in itself but a request for the meta data team to build something. Even in that regards little detailed information is given
While the proposer sounds talented, there isn't much presented on what experience they have with blockchain. In addition, there are several outside dependencies that are not yet realized.

The proposal does not present a staged plan with intermediate goals, nor does it outline a concrete and specific technical approach. Its "detailed plan" asserts or assumes that capabilities such as the Sophia DAO or the IOHK metadata team will implement the solution.

This proposal is very brief with some concrete (albeit frank) notes about what is to be solved and done technically.  Little information is included about the specifics of who will do and what will they do.  There is a reference to a Metadata team, but that could be spelled out a little more for transparency and visibility.
The idea is solid but the proposal is skinny. If more were presented, it would be easier to envision how this will be implemented.
Again it is not really a proposal itself, the the proposer even stated they don't want the funds, but for them to be given to the metadata team.

The proposal doesn't provide any concrete measurable details that would show progress. It also doesn't provide goals for the proposal.  The proposal mentions giving the funds to another entity that isn't identified.

The proposal does not include a roadmap that could be used for auditing progress. It also does not detail a clearly specified and measurable final goal: as stated, the goal is simply presented as an abstract statement of need.

Very little information about deliveries, roadmap, features, and priorities is included in this proposal.  Very little to help benchmark progress and/or show the way to go through development and a measurement of success.
There isn't sufficient information to audit this proposal, because there is no road map or implementation plan. In addition, how will the protocol be standardized without bugs, securely?

solution: As we deal with increasing aspects of secure financial data, we need an Encrypted NFT and Metadata Label standard for accessing secure data.
